skill.name: woocommerce-code-review
skill.description: Review WooCommerce code changes for coding standards compliance. Use when reviewing code locally, performing automated PR reviews, or checking code quality.

skill.author: woocommerce

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides coding standards guidelines for WooCommerce development. It contains no executable code, network calls, or file system access. The skill only provides text-based guidelines for code review processes.

content.value_statement: Ensuring code quality in WooCommerce development can be challenging with multiple coding standards. This skill automates code review by checking against WooCommerce's specific PHP, JavaScript, and UI text guidelines.
actual_capabilities: Detects PHP architecture violations like standalone functions and incorrect dependency injection
Identifies naming convention violations including camelCase and Yoda conditions
Flags missing documentation requirements like @since annotations
Checks UI text for proper sentence case usage
Provides specific fixes with links to relevant skill documentation
limitations: Only reviews code against WooCommerce-specific standards
Requires manual invocation for each code review
Limited to the standards documented in related WooCommerce skills

use_cases.title: Ensure Code Quality
use_cases.description: Review pull requests for compliance with WooCommerce coding standards before merging

use_cases.title: Automated Standards Check
use_cases.description: Quickly identify critical violations in PHP and JavaScript code changes

use_cases.title: Maintain Consistency
use_cases.description: Standardize code across team members following WooCommerce conventions

prompt_templates.title: Basic PHP Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review PHP code for standards compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this WooCommerce PHP code for critical violations: [paste code]. Check for standalone functions, incorrect DI usage, naming conventions, and missing documentation.

prompt_templates.title: UI Text Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check these WooCommerce UI strings for proper sentence case: [paste text]. Flag any Title Case usage that should be sentence case.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this WooCommerce code for dependency injection violations. Check if classes use $container->get() instead of new, and if internal classes are in src/Internal/.

prompt_templates.title: Complete PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete WooCommerce code review on this PR. Check PHP standards, UI text, documentation, and architecture. Group violations by type with specific fixes.

output_examples.input: Review this WooCommerce PHP code: class MyClass { public function getData() { return new Order(); } }
output: âŒ Dependency Injection: Using 'new' for DI-managed class
Fix: Use $container->get( Order::class ) instead of new Order()

best_practices: Always cite specific skill documentation when flagging violations
Group related issues together for clearer feedback
Provide correct examples from skill documentation in your review
anti_patterns: Don't flag style preferences not covered in WooCommerce standards
Avoid reviewing code without citing the relevant skill documentation
Never assume standards - always reference specific skill files

faq.question: What coding standards does this skill check?
faq.answer: It checks WooCommerce-specific standards for PHP architecture, naming conventions, documentation, and UI text formatting.

faq.question: Can this skill automatically fix code violations?
faq.answer: No, it only identifies violations and provides guidance on how to fix them with examples from skill documentation.

faq.question: How do I use this with pull request reviews?
faq.answer: Invoke the skill when reviewing PRs to automatically check code against WooCommerce standards before approval.

faq.question: Does it check JavaScript/React code too?
faq.answer: Yes, it checks UI text in JavaScript/React code for proper sentence case usage according to WooCommerce guidelines.

faq.question: What if the standards conflict with my preferences?
faq.answer: Follow WooCommerce standards when contributing to WooCommerce core. These are project-specific requirements.

faq.question: How detailed are the violation reports?
faq.answer: Reports include violation type, exact location, link to relevant skill documentation, and specific fix guidance.
